channel.title: CyberNetSec - Patch Management
channel.description: Latest patch management threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: CISA: Critical SmarterMail RCE Flaw Actively Exploited in Ransomware Attacks
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in SmarterTools' SmarterMail, CVE-2026-24423, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 9.3, allows an unauthenticated attac...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Ransomware, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Issues Directive Forcing Removal of Unsupported Edge Devices from Federal Networks
item.description:
In response to increasing exploitation by nation-state actors, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 26-02. The directive mandates that all Federal Civilian Executive Branch (FCEB) agencies inventory and remove all unsupported...

Severity: High

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cisco and F5 Release Urgent Patches for High-Severity DoS and RCE Vulnerabilities
item.description:
Networking giants Cisco and F5 have released a wave of security updates to address multiple high-severity vulnerabilities across their product lines. Cisco patched five flaws, including a remote DoS bug in TelePresence/RoomOS (CVE-2026-20119) and a root-level command execution flaw in Meeting Manage...

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: SolarWinds Discloses Five Critical RCE & Auth Bypass Flaws in Web Help Desk
item.description:
SolarWinds has disclosed a set of five critical vulnerabilities in its Web Help Desk (WHD) platform, a tool used by over 300,000 organizations. The flaws include two unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities and two authentication bypasses, each with a CVSS score of 9.8. This incid...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Flaws in Django Framework Expose Sites to DoS and SQL Injection
item.description:
The maintainers of the Django web framework have released important security updates to address critical vulnerabilities. The flaws could allow remote attackers to conduct Denial-of-Service (DoS) and potential SQL injection attacks against web applications built with the framework. Due to the severi...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical RCE Flaw in Ingress-NGINX Threatens Kubernetes Clusters
item.description:
A critical vulnerability has been discovered in the widely used Ingress-NGINX controller for Kubernetes. The flaw could allow a remote attacker to achieve arbitrary code execution within the context of the ingress controller. A successful exploit could lead to a full compromise of the ingress, enabl...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Samsung's February 2026 Update Fixes 37 Flaws in Galaxy Devices
item.description:
Samsung has released its February 2026 security update for its Galaxy smartphones, tablets, and foldable devices. The update addresses a total of 37 vulnerabilities. This includes 25 patches from Google for the core Android OS and 12 Samsung-specific patches (SVEs) for its One UI software. The Samsu...

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Google Patches Multiple Vulnerabilities in February 2026 Pixel Update
item.description:
Google has released its monthly security update for all supported Pixel devices as part of its February 2026 patch cycle. The update addresses numerous security vulnerabilities detailed in the Android and Pixel-specific security bulletins. Installing the update will bring all supported Pixel devices...

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: CRITICAL: Ivanti Patches Two Actively Exploited RCE Zero-Days in EPMM
item.description:
Ivanti has released urgent security patches for two critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities, CVE-2026-1281 and CVE-2026-1340, affecting its Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) solution, formerly MobileIron Core. Both flaws are rated 9.8 out of 10 on the CVSS scale and are confirmed to be act...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical RCE Flaws in n8n Workflow Platform Put Thousands of Instances at Risk
item.description:
Two new high-severity vulnerabilities have been discovered in the n8n workflow automation platform, a tool that often holds credentials to critical corporate systems. The most severe flaw, CVE-2026-1470, is a critical eval injection vulnerability (CVSS 9.9) that allows an authenticated attacker to b...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management
